column2: subject=''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', publication

column1: [[Stanley Unwin]] had asked his son [[Rayner Unwin
column2: Rayner]] for advice about publishing ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' and ''[[The Silmarillion]]''. Rayner proposed publishing the former and dropping the latter.

column1: Tolkien became angry by the corporate thinking of Unwin and his son, and demanded an immediate "yes" or "no" about publishing both books.
This letter marked the beginning of a feud Tolkien had with [[Allen and Unwin
column2: Allen & Unwin]], and several letters later prompted him to write the "[[Letter 131
column3: Milton Waldman Letter]]". For more on this episode, see [[Humphrey Carpenter]]'s ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: A Biography]]'', part ''VI 1949-1966: Success'', chapter 1, "Slamming the Gates".
